title: [JIT] addc{div,mul} type issues - scalar accumulation
body_html:
Two operator-level tests failing with addcdiv issues with types. It appears the accumulation input (a scalar literal) is Double but the div operands are Float:

Example failure:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_addcdiv_scalar_scale (__main__.TestAutogradGenerated)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_autograd.py", line 3665, in do_test
    check(name)
  File "test/test_autograd.py", line 3592, in check
    fn, (self_variable,) + args_variable)
  File "test/test_autograd.py", line 3498, in check_against_reference
    outputs_test = func(*nograd_inputs)
  File "test/test_autograd.py", line 3474, in script_fn
    return output_process_fn(CU.the_method(*tensors))
RuntimeError: 
Expected object of type CPUDoubleType but found type CPUFloatType for argument #3 'tensor1' (checked_cast_tensor at ../aten/src/ATen/Utils.h:32)
frame #0: at::CPUDoubleType::s_addcdiv(at::Tensor const&, at::Tensor const&, at::Tensor const&, at::Scalar) const + 0x8c (0x7fa6c069c2ec in /data/users/zdevito/pytorch/torch/lib/libcaffe2.so.1)
frame #1: at::Type::addcdiv(at::Tensor const&, at::Tensor const&, at::Tensor const&, at::Scalar) const + 0x130 (0x7fa6c078ed60 in /data/users/zdevito/pytorch/torch/lib/libcaffe2.so.1)

frame #7: torch::jit::GraphExecutorImpl::run(torch::jit::variable_tensor_list) + 0xcfd (0x7fa6c1e8623d in /data/users/zdevito/pytorch/torch/_C.so)

:
operation failed shape propagation:

def the_method(i0, i1, i2):
    return i0.addcdiv(0.5, i1, i2)
           ~~~~~~~~~~ <--- HERE

Affected tests:

  • test_addcdiv_scalar_scale
  • test_addcdiv_scalar_scale_broadcast_rhs
  • test_addcmul_scalar_scale
  • test_addcmul_scalar_scale_broadcast_rhs

Two operator-level tests failing with addcdiv issues with types. It appears the accumulation input (a scalar literal) is Double but the div operands are Float:
Example failure:

body:
Two operator-level tests failing with `addcdiv` issues with types. It appears the accumulation input (a scalar literal) is Double but the div operands are Float:

Example failure:

```

    outputs_test = func(*nograd_inputs)

    return output_process_fn(CU.the_method(*tensors))
```
